## Description {#details}

Simple wrapper around std::function&lt;void(raw&#95;ostream&amp;)&gt;.

This class is useful to construct print helpers for <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a>.

Example: <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/printable">Printable</a> printRegister(unsigned Register) &#123; return <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/printable">Printable</a>(&#91;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a>&#93;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;OS) &#123; OS &lt;&lt; getRegisterName(Register); &#125;); &#125; ... OS &lt;&lt; printRegister(Register); ...

Implementation note: Ideally this would just be a typedef, but doing so leads to operator &lt;&lt; being ambiguous as function has matching constructors in some STL versions. I have seen the problem on gcc 4.6 libstdc++ and microsoft STL.

Definition at line 38 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/printable-h">Printable.h</a>.
